summary.title: Learn Bash and SQL by Building a Bike Rental Shop
summary.description: > Welcome to the SQL Joins and Functions Lessons!

commands: sudo -u postgres psql -c "CREATE USER freecodecamp WITH CREATEDB;"

steps.content: **The first thing you need to do is start the terminal.** Do that by clicking the "hamburger" menu at the top left of the screen, going to the "terminal" section, and clicking "new terminal". Once you open a new one, type `echo hello world` into the terminal and press enter.
hints: If the tests don't run automatically, try typing `exit` into the terminal and redoing the instructions

steps.content: Create first_name column - varchar(50) not null
Create last_name column - varchar(50) not null
Create major_id column - serial primary key
Create major column - varchar(50) not null
Create student_id column in gpas - int primary key
Set student_id in gpas as foreign key
Create gpa column - numeric(2, 1) not null
Create student_id column - int - in s_m
Create componsite pKey - alter table _ add primary key (s_id, m_id);
Add comment - Script to insert data from students.csv into students database

Add | while read
do 
  echo $something
done

add if [[ $INSERT_STUDENT_RESULT == "INSERT 0 1" ]]
then
  echo success message
fi
Add echo $($PSQL "TRUNCATE students, gpas, majors, students_majors;")

Add if [[ $INSERT_GPA_RESULT == "INSERT 0 1" ]]
then
  echo success
fi

Add if [[ -z $MAJOR_ID ]]
then
  echo major_id not found
fi

Add if [[ INSERT_MAJOR RESULT == "INSERT 0 1" ]]
then
  echo success
fi

Add if [[ INSERT_S_M_RESULT == INSERT 0 1 ]]
then
 echo success
fi
Add comment # Info about my computer science students from students database
Add echo -e "\n~~ My Computer Science Students ~~\n"
